title: Dorrigo Shire
text:
Dorrigo Shire was a <a href="Local%20government%20in%20Australia">local government area</a> in the <a href="Mid%20North%20Coast">Mid North Coast</a> region of <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a>, Australia.
Dorrigo Shire was proclaimed on 7 March 1906, one of 134 shires created after the passing of the "<a href="Local%20Government%20%28Shires%29%20Act%201905">Local Government (Shires) Act 1905</a>". The shire was divided to form <a href="Nymboida%20Shire">Nymboida Shire</a> on 5 August 1913.
The shire offices were originally in <a href="Coramba%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Coramba</a> but by 1951 had moved to <a href="Coffs%20Harbour">Coffs Harbour</a>. Other towns in the shire included <a href="Dorrigo%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Dorrigo</a>, <a href="Woolgoolga">Woolgoolga</a> and <a href="Glenreagh">Glenreagh</a>.
Dorrigo Shire was abolished on 1 January 1957 and split between <a href="Bellingen%20Shire">Bellingen Shire</a> and the newly created <a href="City%20of%20Coffs%20Harbour">Coff's Harbour Shire</a> .
